verses.text: ¶ In that day shall this song be sung in the land of Judah: We have a strong city; salvation will he appoint for walls and bulwarks.
Open ye the gates, that the righteous nation which keepeth faith may enter in.
[a]Thou wilt keep [b]in perfect peace, [c]mind stayed ; because he trusteth in thee.

footnotes.a: Or, A stedfast mind thou keepest in perfect peace, because it etc.

verses.text: Trust ye in Jehovah for ever; for in [d]Jehovah, Jehovah, is an [e]everlasting rock.
For he hath brought down them that dwell on high, the lofty city: he layeth it low, he layeth it low even to the ground; he bringeth it even to the dust.
The foot shall tread it down; even the feet of the poor, and the steps of the needy.
The way of the just is [f]uprightness: thou that art upright dost [g]direct the path of the just.

footnotes.f: Or, a right way; the path of the just thou directest aright

verses.text: ¶ Yea, in the way of thy judgments, O Jehovah, have we waited for thee; to thy name, even to thy memorial , is the desire of our soul.
With my soul have I desired thee in the night; yea, with my spirit within me will I seek thee earnestly: for when thy judgments are in the earth, the inhabitants of the world learn righteousness.
Let favor be showed to the wicked, yet will he not learn righteousness; in the land of uprightness will he deal wrongfully, and will not behold the majesty of Jehovah.
¶ Jehovah, thy hand is lifted up, yet they see not: but they shall see [h] zeal for the people, and be put to shame; yea, [i]fire shall devour thine adversaries.

footnotes.h: Or, and be put to shame, in their envy at the people

footnotes.i: Or, the fire of thine adversaries shall devour them

verses.text: Jehovah, thou wilt ordain peace for us; for thou hast also wrought all our works for us.
O Jehovah our God, other lords besides thee have had dominion over us; but by thee only will we make mention of thy name.
[j] dead, they shall not live; [k]deceased, they shall not rise: therefore hast thou visited and destroyed them, and made all remembrance of them to perish.

footnotes.j: Or, The dead live not, the deceased rise not

verses.text: Thou hast increased the nation, O Jehovah, thou hast increased the nation; thou art glorified; [l]thou hast enlarged all the borders of the land.

footnotes.l: Or, thou hast removed it far unto all the ends of the earth

verses.text: ¶ Jehovah, in trouble have they [m]visited thee; they poured out a [n]prayer thy chastening was upon them.
Like as a woman with child, that draweth near the time of her delivery, is in pain and crieth out in her pangs; so we have been [o]before thee, O Jehovah.
We have been with child, we have been in pain, we have as it were brought forth wind; we have not wrought any deliverance in the earth; [p]neither have the inhabitants of the world fallen.

footnotes.p: Or, neither have inhabitants of the world been born

verses.text: Thy dead shall live; my dead bodies shall arise. Awake and sing, ye that dwell in the dust; for thy dew is the dew of [q]herbs, and the earth shall cast forth [r]the dead.
¶ Come, my people, enter thou into thy chambers, and shut thy doors about thee: hide thyself for a little moment, until the indignation be overpast.
For, behold, Jehovah cometh forth out of his place to punish the inhabitants of the earth for their iniquity: the earth also shall disclose her blood, and shall no more cover her slain.
